title: Contract review: tighten specs and expand test coverage
description: Review all existing contracts (SemanticNode, ElementSpec, Finding, ValidatorSpec) with these questions: 1) Can we make validation stricter? (e.g., regex patterns, enums for known types) 2) Are we missing edge case tests? 3) Can we add property-based tests or fuzz testing? Goal: maximize confidence, catch bugs early.
close_reason: Completed comprehensive contract review: tightened validation with regex patterns, added max lengths, prevented XSS, validated formats (kebab-case, semver, UPPERCASE_SNAKE_CASE, JSONPath, ARIA roles). Added 84 edge case tests covering whitespace, length limits, special characters, deep nesting, and security. All 104 tests pass.

title: Example: recreate MDN good-semantics.html with our elements
description:
Create working example that recreates the MDN accessibility semantic HTML example using our ElementSpec and SemanticNode contracts.

Source: https://github.com/mdn/learning-area/tree/main/accessibility/html
Live demo: https://mdn.github.io/learning-area/accessibility/html/good-semantics.html

This validates:
1) Our contracts can represent real semantic HTML structure
2) Validators work correctly on realistic page structure
3) Provides reference implementation showing how to use the system
4) Tests can validate the structure and run validators against it

Implementation:
- Parse/convert the good-semantics.html to our contract types
- Create tests that validate structure correctness
- Run validateNameRequired and verify findings
- Document as examples/mdn-good-semantics/

title: validateNameRequired - first invariant (TDD)
description: TDD workflow: 1) Write failing tests first in tests/validate/name_required_test.ts (flags unnamed button, passes named button, walks nested children). 2) Implement src/validate/nameable.ts with validateNameRequired(root: SemanticNode): Finding[]. Interactive types (button, link, textbox, checkbox, radio) must have a non-empty name. Walk tree recursively, return Finding[] with code='missing-name'.
